snippet: Less than a month after the cease-fire was signed, a rebel leader’s hometown was attacked and humanitarian aid workers have been forced to evacuate certain areas.
abstract: Both rebels and government officials in South Sudan say fighting continues despite cease-fire agreement meant to bring peace to young nation while broader political solution is found; ranks of displaced people have swelled to nearly 900,000, close to a tenth of the entire population, and humanitarian groups have been forced to evacuate certain areas because of violence.
lead_paragraph: Less than a month after the cease-fire was signed, a rebel leader’s hometown was attacked and humanitarian aid workers have been forced to evacuate certain areas.

headline.main: Reports of South Sudan Fighting, Despite Pact, Prompt Worry and Warnings
headline.print_headline: Reports of South Sudan Fighting, Despite Pact, Prompt Worry and Warnings
